availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harris (Mattoon, Illinois, and Louisville, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Mattoon, Illinois, and Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Callista O. Harris. Father of Mary C. Harris and James S. Harris. Attorney in Mattoon in 1860. Employed Laura Verbruke as a domestic servant in Coles County, Illinois, in 1860. Employed Catharine Sympson as a servant in Coles County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Coles County, Mattoon, p. 53.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 268B.
